Replies.Reply: Six weeks ago, I was ordinary and pathetic.
It was Rochelle's birthday, which meant there was a certain amount of inter-
.so by the time I got back to my cubicle, my eyelids were so damn heavy, I had to put my head down, even if it was just for a wink.
My name is Wesley Gibson. If you look at the corner of my desk, you'll see the billing reports I was supposed to hand in to Janice an hour ago.
I meant to...
I'll do it.
I said I'll get it done. I'm sorry.
My job title is Account Manager. I used to be called an Account Service Representative, but a consultant told us we needed to "manage" our clients and not " service- them.
Her name's Cathy. She works at Banana Republic. The guy she's humping is my best friend, Barry.
Yes. Uh... Well the 602 deals with applications sent by prospective clients and the 603 is when the client is...
I'm sorry, Jesus... uh... what was the question?
Well, that's the thing.-
Cycles. Hard market, industry-wide cycles differ from our firm's cycles so I think it's amistake to apply...
Sure.
There are people, everyday you meet them, who you wish could see you in a different setting, a different place...
And you wish to god your eyeballs weren't being sucked out of their sockets by monitor fatigue. That you didn't spend five years in college to do goddamn differential responses.
C'mon, c'mon.
But at least at the end. of the day...
.you know that tomorrow it's going to start all over again.
What?
I'll be right back.
I got it.
My parents both died when I was born.
The nutjobs I had as foster parents thought any book that didn't contain a red-letter edition was the spawn of the devil...
..so I had to hide my stash like it was a bag of many jane.
I'm sorry?
Sorry?
I think you got the wrong guy.
What is this? How d'you know my name?
My father died in a car wreck the week I was born...
Lady...
The Fraternity?
What is this?
What?!!
Where are we going?
Hold on!
Truck!
No! Shoot the tires!
Who was that?
No. I mean... I told you my father died when I was a baby.
What?
What?!
Like I told... um... the lady here... I think you might ha ve me mixed up with someone else. I'm just an... um...
I... I guess I'm not sure.
What?!
I don't...
But I've never heard of...
Why would you do that?
Fuck consultants and fuck action items and fuck differential responses. Fuck it all.
Fuck it all.
Yeah.
Is this the beginning of my training?
What the fuck are...
You know how when you have a dream and wake up unexpectedly...
...and the dream is still. on the fringe of your brain but you can't quite remember the details?
I... uh...I got hit by a man much bigger than me.
Something like that.
No. Not really. Same old Wesley.
Would you consider me to be an observant person?
SHUT THE FUCK UP11!!1111 It's so unbelievably stunning coming out of Wesley's mouth that it hits Janice like a slap in the face.
Just because you have one single iota of tenuous power, you think you can push everyone around?

.I understand, Janice, that junior high must have been particularly difficult being called Tubby all the time, but that doesn't give you the goddamn right to treat your workers like horseshit. Sure we laugh at you behind your back and sure we know you keep a stash of jelly doughnuts in the top drawer of your desk...

.and sure everyone takes their lunch an hour before you so we can get an extra hour away from you, and I know that must sting sitting by yourself in the White Castle parking lot every day gnawing on your third burger thinking up ways to humiliate us...
.you know, if you weren't such a bitch, we might actually feel sorry for you. As it is, I feel I can speak for the rest of the office when I say... FUCK YOU!!!
You were watching?
Like I had a gun in my hands.
They never show you this shit on the McDonald's commercials.
What is this?
Computer chips?
I suppose you're going to tell me to shoot her first.
Mostly B's.
Okay, I got a D.
I couldn't remember all the rules --
Every day.
I don't get it.
So we set our own rules.
Just the flies.
You mean curve the bullet? How?
Okay.
Fox?
Really?
You worked with him?
My father saved your life? Put a bullet in Burgess?
What kind of training is that?
My father was Burgess, wasn't he?
What?
What's this?
How?
My whole life I thought he was dead. I shouldn't feel any differently just because it happened 20 years later.
But, I do. Like I missed my one chance.
Can I see his body?
These are my father's ashes?
Sloan said his heart stopped but there was no entry wound?
Can I have a minute?

There are two kinds of pain. One is an object. A living thing that crawls around the outside of your body. Cuts, broken bones, bruises... all deliver the kind of pain you can learn to ignore, and they soon disappear to nothing but the sound of a gnat in your ear.
No.
Fine. Try something else.
Nothing.
You told me to hunt down my father's killer. That's what I'm doing.
The bullet that killed him. You said his heart stopped but there was no entrance wound. This bullet has a hole cut into its center...

You know how a mole buries into the earth by pushing the dirt back around it? I think this bullet does what the mole does... Splits the skin and pushes it back through its center, filling the space it just passed through.
Fox was telling me that my father used special bullets. It looks like Cross does too... which means these are custom made. If we find who makes them, then we find someone who has access to Cross.
Firing neurons.
Whatever happened to my father's guns?
What's that?
No rules, right?
What's all this?
This room. The books. Seems low-tech.
What's with the red ones?
You have stashes...
Jesus.
Closer.

Cross and my father were tight. But Cross thought he should be one of the heads of the Fraternity so he left and vowed to kill the three heads. Which means my father is dead because of petty jealousy.
But I don't see jealousy in those eyes, do you?
The journalist who's got a price-tag on his head.
Yeah.
Close the gap. Push the body closer to the target..
Closer.
Closer.
Closer. I'll say when.
You wanna go first?
Check the target.

You'll find one entry below the shoulder, missing the major blood vessels there, exiting the back. Second shot went through the abdomen, clipped only the bowel and exited cleanly. Third hit the upper right quadrant of the abdomen, which is partially protected by the ribcage, and passed through the liver and probably part of the gallbladder. Upper left abdomen is a good place, where number four ruptured the spleen before continuing down main street. And finally, what I like to call "the ,7FK."
Fuck the rules.
One!
..he pulls his arms tight, and his muscles start to twitch and bulge -- muscles we didn't know he had until.
Do you like being the only chick in the Fraternity?
Maybe I have and I'm just not telling you.
How did you end up here, Fox?
What did you do before?
No shit?
I can't see it.
What made them come after you? I mean, I know why I'm here.
And yours is?
That's terrible.
Where's the Diablo?
Being a member of the Fraternity was like winning the lottery...
Where we headed?
You need a new wardrobe or something?
A test?
Who's the mark?
What if I don't?
Get down!
Just like my father used on you.
You were watching me in the office.
You've known all along. You knew before I ever broke the urn...
Part of my training.
There are two things about you I'm sure of right now, little man. One is that you can speak English...
That my nutsack is bigger than you.
Bullshit. You're as responsible as if you pulled the trigger yourself.
I'm only going to ask you one question and I want you to think very hard how you want to answer.
Relax. The blade is in only an inch or so.

See I've learned a thing or two about human anatomy recently. In fact, this blade is stuck just beneath the coastal cartilage of your tenth rib. Just a little push and it will deflate your lung. That's called a pneumothorax.
So my question is... how do I find Cross?
You know what my foster mother. told me when I was six years old?

She caught me eating some jello out of the fridge after my bedtime. I knew I wasn't supposed to but I was so damn hungry, and it was just some fucking jello. Anyway, after she hit me so hard I couldn't bite down straight for a week, she told me... she told me that God had killed my parents because I was such a wicked boy.

So I grew up thinking I was the reason I never knew my parents. But now, to find out, that no, my father didn't give me up because he had died... he gave me up because he was Protecting me... well I guess I want to give him something back.
Not very discreet, are they?
No!
He'll be long gone by then.
On the pallet.
Separate.
Stay here and cover us. There's no angle for him to hit you if you stay here.
Don't let him get up there. And stay clear of the presses! He'll use them however he can.
It's what I'd do.
Cross!
He said... he said 'pies on the Fraternity...' Fox measures him, like she's not sure if he's telling the whole story. Finally, she nods...
Yeah, sure.
I think I need.a minute to myself.
Naah, that's all right. You need to get stitched up. I'll meet you at that Korean place.
Hey.
You live here?
Foster home?
Read this.
Yes, ma'am.
My brother?
I'm okay.
Do you know what this opens?
He left me more than this.
Why didn't he just tell me?
I'll be back as soon as this is over.
Skipped the hospital?
I'm all right.
Naah.
Yeah.
Listen, can I ask you a :question?
Did you know Cross was my father?
Did you know?
Arrrh!
There's a town in Germany called Leverkusen that had a bear hunter named Hans Koblenz.

60 During his life, he was said to have killed over four hundred bears and was the pride of this small community on the Rhine. You want to know how he died? A pair of black bears singled out his house from the entire village, mauled his wife, killed his twin daughters, and then lied in wait for him to get back from the woods.
When the hunter opened the door, they ripped his throat out before he could scream.
My father... he was working on a plan, right?
Can I see that for a second?
Do you know where he got this?
My God, he's been planning it from the beginning.
This is a Fraternity hit. Cross... my fathar... set up Henry Helms as bait, knowing Sloan would use his best men for the job. He was going to take them all out.
Only he didn't know where on the route they would try and hit Helms. That's the missing piece he was t rying to figure out.
No. But I know who does.
It's me, Nicole.
I asked you once if you thought I was an observant person.
Maybe I have and I'm just not telling you.
Sloan didn't just have one person in my office watching me, he had two.
What name do you go by? The Intern?
Because I know you have the mark.
Where's the Henry Helms hit going down?
Yeah? Why's that?
Motherfucker. Dispose of the weapon...
Me.
I'm only going to ask you one more time.
Then this is going to get painful quickly.
Henry Helms. Where is it going down?
The name is Cross.
Looks like you missed your chance. Now where is Sloan?
She told me that, too.
Should've studied your anatomy, fellas.
I remember some dumb shit like that coming out of your mouth.
But you can hear. So hear this: To cut the subclavian artery, hold the knife ice-
...and thrust down behind the clavicle, cutting side to side.
I'm working off of a different map.
Where is he?
But now you have to dispose of the weapon.
Fuck you.
Six weeks ago, I was ordinary and pathetic.
But not today.
I'm done with this life. Just like my father.
It's true. Six weeks ago I was ordinary and-pathetic. Just like you.
But I've learned something in that time.
I've learned about the man I am.
I've learned that all of us are unique, even though sometimes we're too fucking blind to see it.
Just started last week.
All over the place, really. Nothing too exciting.
Yes, sir.
Of course.
You want to take a break with me?
Well, you'll find there's nothing "usual"
This life is ours, to make of it what we can.
I think I'll give it a shot.
I didn't expect for you yourself to come.
I'm flattered.
The name of the target is Henry Helms.
He's a journalist who stumbled on to a story exposing a lot of powerful people, people who don't like having their power threatened.
There.have been five attempts on his life, but he has been well protected...
And for that, my clients will pay handsomely.
C'mon, c'mon, c'mon.
Okay... okay...
We're... we're just the decoys, man. We were paid to get you out here...
It was a set-up all the way?
That's two heads in two weeks. Which leaves only one: you.
And killing all three heads gets him that?
Well, I don't know if we have anyone who can stop him.
Yeah? Who?
There is a remedy for all things but death.
You apologize too much.
Spina bifida babies have more backbone than you.
I knew your father.
Can't say that I agree with you, Wesley.
Your father...
,Your father died two days ago on the rooftop. of the Metropolitan Building.
He'd be damn disappointed in what you've become, too.
I've been called a lot of things, but "lady" ain't one of 'em.
Damn, Wesley, how d'you ever learn anything when you won't keep your mouth shut and your ears open? I'm trying to tell you about your father.
assassin to ever live. Your father, Wesley, worked for the Fraternity.
Your father, Wesley, was set up and gunned down by a man he used to consider a friend. And your father, Wesley...
.taught me everything I know.
This is what you've dreamt about all your life.
Move! Now!
Drive!
Just drive!
Go around it!
There's a lot of things you don't know about yourself, Wesley.
That... was the man who killed your father. And now he's trying to kill you.
Have you ever believed that? Have you ever been content with that answer?
Today's your new birthday, Wesley.
The people I work with... we believe your father passed his skills on genetically to you. You knew how to handle the car, you knew to shoot at the truck.
It's that confidence we're gonna need to work on.
Now I want you to look at me and tell me something. And I want you to be honest with me.
Do you think I look fat in this outfit?
I thought so. Let's go.
Mr. Sloan.
This is Wesley Gibson. He needs his life changed.
Like I said, you got the skills.
What's up, new man?
Never stopped. How'd it feel, saying exactly what you wanted to say?
You need to get used to the blood and the muscle and the meat and the sinew and what a single blade of steel can do to a chunk of flesh.
Take care of him, Butcher.
You haven't quite figured out this whole "blending in" thing, yet. Let's go.
This...
This is the Roach Motel, Wesley.
All right, find us some skinny bitches.
Nahh, let the brother rest. Find us some white meat. And nothing too fat.
Perfect. Load up soccer mom.
You can take the couch until we find you someplace better.
Come on.
Your father lov ed you, Wesley. He talked about you all the time.
That's a fact. He knew he wasn't supposed to, but he couldn't help it.
He trained me. Made me what I am.

I remember one night he had me on my own .for the first time, and I was tagging this target named Buster Burgess. But I was green and clumsy and stupid. Buster marked me and disappeared into this old tenement building.
Motherfucker shot mein the leg. Put a damn hole in my favorite skirt.
Naww. I ended up with four more slugs in me.
I'm here, aren't I?
He didn't hit me anywhere important, and he used pin-shot bullets that didn't do any real damage. But you can be damn sure I don't let any mark get the high ground on me again.
And you know what we did instead of go to the hospital to stitch me up?
We went driving.
This is where your father was killed.

We're not sure. The fence he was meeting was shot in the head... which led him out to here... but it must've been a set-up all along. All I know is it would take a hell of a trap to bring your father down.
But...
Well that's why you're here. To make up for lost time.
We cremate our dead. I'd like to say it's to honor them, but it's mainly to keep anyone from identifying them after they're gone.
Yeah.
That's right.
Sure.
More reason for Cross to die.
Listen .to me, Wesley. In two weeks, we have to kill Henry Helms. Do-you know who that is?
A price-tag that we're going to collect.
We've never defaulted on a job and this 1k one won't be the first.
May have found your match, Sloan.
Just run it out there. Let the kid work.
Don't you quit now, baby! Don't you quit now!!
Sloan says you're ready.
Who said I was the only sister? Maybe you just haven't met any others yet.
Hold still.
Same way you did, sugar. They found me.
Sold perfume. At the mall.
No shit.
Get in line.
Fraternity members all have something in their lineage that shows they'll be good at this.

My great-great-great-grandfather on my mother's side. He was on a slave ship coming over from East Africa and as it was pulling into Charleston, he killed every white man on the ship and swam to shore. They caught him and hung him four days later.
I Nah. Motherfucker deserved it. Be raped eight women in those four days. One of them was my great-great-great-grandmama.
I got tired of the color.
Trial by fire, sugar. Hook a right.
Park it here, baby.
we're here for a reason and it ain't clothes-shopping. Somewhere in that crowd is your first target.
The real thing.
You'll know him when you see him.
Then you get shot.
It's graduation day, baby.
Pin shot bullets.
Protecting our assets.
Time to do this for real.
A bullet you made killed his father.
Wesley, you gotta know something. No matter what kind of training you've done these last few weeks, killing your first, well that's gonna change you forever.
Jesus. Someone needs to find that bitch and set her straight.
Here we are.
The others are only backup singers. This is your show.
Remember: he's good, baby. But you're the best I've ever seen.
He's got the high ground.
Fuuuucckkk!
Keep goin', baby! Take him!
You did it, baby! Son of a bitch, you did it. You put down motherfucking Cross!
What'd he say to you?
Well... damn, I couldn't be more proud of you, baby! Let's go lay this on Sloan!
What's wrong?
Sure. It's your first kill. I'll wait for you...
You sure?
Jesus.
For a second there I thought you looked just like Cross.
He picked me clean and I don't care much for needles.
Sloan's on his way.
You want something to eat, baby?
They got some good shit. Ostrich, chicken... won't fill you up too much if you're watching your calories.
Well, the big man should be here any minute...
Baby, you can ask me anything you want.
What?
Goddammit, Wesley...
Why'd you have to ask me that?
You shoulda known better, baby...
Aaaaahhhh!
I gotta admit, baby...
I thought we might have a future...
Who said I was the only sister? Maybe you just haven't met any others yet..
He wants out.
There's one person who can.
Fox told you about your father?
When?
Shoot the wings off the flies.
Shoot... the wings... off the flies.
You have three seconds. Three... two...
And after we fine tune those skills...
.you're going to hunt the man who killed Your father.
Walk with me.

I know thin is hard for you to understand, Wesley, but I want you to concentrate on what I'm saying. Your father was a member of the Fraternity, a collection of the most powerful assassins the world has ever known.
We don't advertise Wesley. We blend into the environment like moths against a tree.
We stay in the shadows.
We disappear into our surroundings.
Because the easiest place to hide is in plain sight...
..until that time when we are called into action.
And when the time comes that we are called, death is as certain as the sun.
We have been active for centuries, Wesley... outlasting rulers, governments, nations, kings. We recognize no borders; the entire globe is our killing field.
We are the baddest of the bad, the three-
This man left the Fraternity and decided to strike down those who had befriended him, trained him, made him who he is.
..a son whose mother died in childbirth...
Your father was like a brother to me.
I will do anything to avenge his death.' Sloan turns off the monitors and pulls over a wooden chair from where it rests by a wall.
So Wesley... you have a choice. Would you like to go back to your job, your girlfriend, your life, just as it was before?
Or would you like to begin your training with an assassin's Fraternity that writes the world's history in blood and bullets?
If the answer is the latter, then have a seat in that chair.
If not, you're welcome to head out this door here and we'll never see each other again.
Selecting your weapon and then disposing of it is the most pivotal aspect of every assassination.
Pick one.
And the Imanishi's bullets have microchips that communicate with similar ones in the gun.
Sometimes the closest distance between two points is not a straight line. What if soccer mom here is between you and your target?
How'd you do in Physics class?
Why?
That's it. Rules. What if I told you there weren't any?
People live by the rules set before them.
Because you use your brain differently than other people. All Fraternity members do.

Humans use neurons to think. But most people can only handle a small percentage of those neurons firing at once without suffering a seizure or an aneurism. Not us. And not you. We have the ability to think differently than other people.
That's right.
Have you ever shot a gun before?
So you have no pre-conceived habits we need to break. Shoot the target. Don't hit mom.

This isn't about "how." It's about "what." If you'd never been told a bullet flies straight and I handed you this and said hit that target... what would you do? Allow your instincts to guide you. Just like the flies.
The technology is only here to assist your natural instinct.
It's not 'will' that makes the physical react how we wish, it's 'control.' You are in control...
Rules are made to be broken, Wesley. No one was better at that than your father.
Watch the eyes. Look for a slight swelling of the pupil. You can train your body to stay a constant temperature, you can control your heartbeat, but you can't control the center of your eyes.
Do you want to fuck Fox?
I know that's a lie without even seeing your eyes.
Okay. What are you hiding from me?
What's this?
Yes?
You put this all together on your own?
Don't know. But whoever has them isn't long for this place.
Cross. The details of his life.
No rules.
We keep a record of every assassination mission, going back to the Ides of March.
Where we plot our local hits. This city is one of the Fraternity's major headquarters.
Part of mastering technology is knowing when to use it. Models can't be hacked.
The Fraternity's grasp reaches every facet of the world's major cities, including their construction. Look at this streetlight.
.everywhere.
Keep moving, fellas.
They let us do our jobs, we let them live.
Our job isn't just about how fast or true you shoot, Wesley. Physical agility will always lose to mental agility. It's warfare of the mind.
Pick the weapon, make the kill, destroy the weapon. No other rules.
There are limits to everything, Wesley.
He's ready.
The mole bullet is made by a midget t Filipino named Pek War. His fingers are so small that they can shape and smooth the metal better than anyone.
I had to let you figure it out for yourself.
Part of your quest. To get to know your father.
And his killer.
Pek War charges exorbitant prices, as much as ten-thousand dollars for a single round, but his craftsmanship is unparalleled.
He knows.
Hold until I give the word.
Here comes the car. Any minute now.
Can't say I don't have a sense of irony.
You once asked why I helped hide you as an infant... It gave me power, Wesley'.
In some ways it pains me to do so. You 460 are like the son I never had.
Fine. Keep your worthless dignity.
You can't win, Wesley. The Fraternity is everywhere. Even if you kill me others will come from other cities to take my place. You'll be hunted your whole life.
But that's not gonna happen. Like I told you before, when we are called, death is as certain as the sun.
Go ahead and shoot me, killer. Just like you did your old man.

Oh my fucking god I hope that's not my billing report sitting on your fucking desk. Holy shit on an altar, it isl A couple of the other OFFICE WORKERS look up at the fireworks and smile... like they're actually enjoying Janice's histrionics.

why don't you just take a dump in your hands, fork it over to me and say, "this is the best effort I'm gonna give to you, Janice. This is the best you're ever gonna get out of me." Hell, Rochelle on her bbirthdav is doing a better a job than your lazy ass and she's already left for the day. Je-sus CHRIST!
I meant to... I meant to... Well I meant to be a size four but meaning to doesn't pick no cotton.
Tell you what. I'll just input the four-
Minimum for the maximum. That's all you ever do. The minimum you can do to suck the maximum from this company.
No, you're worthless. I'm the one who's sorry I hired you.

Jesus H. Fucking Popscile, you don't have time to get me the differential responses but you got time to chitty-chatty with the intern? Why do I even keep you around, Wesley? Well I know one thing, your review is coming up next week and I can't wait to start checking me off some boxes... attitude: poor, performance: poor, management skills: poor, works well with others...
I asked you about the effects of net investment income with regards to underwriting cycles.
What's the thing?
Son... everyone knows that net investment income is inversely related to both premium and loss reserves, making firm cycles inherently dependent on industry cycles!
In fact, to prove my point, I'd like you to spend some time this afternoon adding up the yearly differential responses.
Good God a'mighty.
Get it to me by five.
He was aggressive toward me and other employees... a very negative person, extremely negative. I can't even repeat the words that came out of his mouth the day we let him go...
Nicole! Get your ass over here and.tell us what the hell is going on with you and Whitcock the big cock!
Where's the spaghetti?
I specifically told you to get noodles on your way home. God, Wesley, I already put the sauce on.
You didn't listen is what you didn't.- I might as well talk to the wall.
Oh my god, Wesley, where have you been?
What're you doing? Are you leaving? You .owe rent!
You can't leave! This is bullshit, Wesley. Bullshit, bullshit, bullshit.
Who the fuck are you?
You're nothing, Wesley! And you will always be nothing! You think you're gonna be happy.with that skank...
You want me to go with you, buddy?
Wesley... hey dude.
Thanks for calling me. I wanted to say...
Whoa, man!!
What happened to your face?
Was this over a girl?
I had no idea you had such a secret life outside of here.
Is there something different about you?
I don't think so.
You aren't like these people Wesley.
What's that mean?
Uh-oh, here comes the wicked bitch of the west...
Jesus...
Wesley? Is that you?
What happened to you?
What are you talking about?
Sloan's not your biggest problem, fuckface.

That's right. And the cops were told to watch this place too. You have nowhere to go. He's smarter than you. He'll feed the cops evidence singling you out for every hit the Fraternity has pulled in the last ten years.
You won't get to him. You can't. The cops will be here any second!
That was great dude!
What was my father like?
Sir...
Gunsmith starts sliding the target closer to the body, until it's actually touching the back of the dead business man!
Andey?
Andey?l Two louder THUMPS and a GUNSHOT jerk his head around.
Alam man lamangl Alam man lamangl Wesley signals for him to turn around. After he does...
My clients use middlemen, I don't meet them in person, I know so little about them...
Okayl Okayl Dammitl God damiaitl I'll tell you!

Alam man lamang!
And what's the other?
What do you want?
I only mold the ammunition... I cannot be responsible for the way it is...
I didn't...
We need a way in there.
How do you know?
Let's find another door.
Wesley!
Look into my eyes!
Look into my eyes, goddammit!
Everything they told you was a lie, Wesley.
Find the missing piece. And... don't...
Hey.
Come in, Wesley.
He's dead, isn't he?
He told me if he didn't come back... it would be you who pulled the trigger.
I think you need to meet someone...
Wesley. This is your brother... Andrew.
Half-brother. But both of you, you are both 100 percent your.father's boys.
Your father... he was with you the whole time.
This was his favorite.
When your father and I found each other, when we had Andrew, he said he could no longer live the way he had been living.
It was his greatest regret.
would you like some coffee?
I guess it's not much of an inheritance.
